trans-unit.source: Provides a base class for strongly typed connection string builders.

The DbConnectionStringBuilder class provides the base class from which the strongly typed connection string builders (<xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnectionStringBuilder>, <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbConnectionStringBuilder>, and so on) derive.
The connection string builders let developers programmatically create syntactically correct connection strings, and parse and rebuild existing connection strings.
The DbConnectionStringBuilder has been defined in a database-agnostic manner.

Because of the addition of the <xref:System.Data.Common> namespace, developers require a base class against which they can program in order to build connection strings that can work against an arbitrary database.
Therefore, the DbConnectionStringBuilder class lets users assign arbitrary key/value pairs and pass the resulting connection string to a strongly typed provider.

All the data providers that are included as part of the .NET Framework provide a strongly typed class that inherits from DbConnectionStringBuilder: <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnectionStringBuilder>, <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleConnectionStringBuilder>, <xref:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcConnectionStringBuilder>, and <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbConnectionStringBuilder>.
The developer can build, assign, and edit connection strings for any arbitrary provider.
For providers that support specific key/value pairs, the connection string builder provides strongly typed properties corresponding to the known pairs.
In order to support providers that require the ability to support unknown values, developers can also supply arbitrary key/value pairs.
The DbConnectionStringBuilder class implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
This means that the class works with Visual Studio designers at design time.

When developers use the designer to build strongly typed DataSets and strongly typed connections within Visual Studio, the strongly typed connection string builder class will display the properties associated with its type and will also have converters that can map common values for known keys.
Developers needing to create connection strings as part of applications can use the DbConnectionStringBuilder class or one of its strongly typed derivatives to build and modify connection strings.
The DbConnectionStringBuilder class also makes it easy to manage connection strings stored in an application configuration file.
Developers can create connection strings using either a strongly typed connection string builder class, or they can use the DbConnectionStringBuilder class.
The DbConnectionStringBuilder performs no checks for valid key/value pairs.
Therefore, it is possible using this class to create invalid connection strings.
The <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnectionStringBuilder> supports only key/value pairs that are supported by SQL Server; trying to add invalid pairs will throw an exception.
Both the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder.Add%2A> method and <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder.Item%2A> property handle tries to insert malicious entries.

For example, the following code correctly escapes the nested key/value pair: [Visual Basic] ``` Dim builder As New System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder builder("Data Source") = "(local)" builder("integrated sSecurity") = True builder("Initial Catalog") = "AdventureWorks;NewValue=Bad" ``` [C#] ``` System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder builder = new System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder(); builder["Data Source"] = "(local)"; builder["integrated Security"] = true; builder["Initial Catalog"] = "AdventureWorks;NewValue=Bad"; ``` The result is the following connection string that handles the invalid value in a safe manner: ``` data source=(local);integrated security=True; initial catalog="AdventureWorks;NewValue=Bad" ```
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> class, optionally using ODBC rules for quoting values.
If `useOdbcRules` is `true`, this <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> uses ODBC rules for quoting values (surrounding values with curly braces ({})).
If `useOdbcRules` is `false`, this <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> uses quotation mark character ("") to delimit values.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to use {} to delimit fields; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to use quotation marks.
Adds an entry with the specified key and value into the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder.Item%2A> property can also be used to add new elements by setting the value of a key that does not exist in the dictionary.
For example: `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`.
Calling the Add method by passing a null (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) key throws an <xref:System.ArgumentNullException>.
However, calling the Add method by passing a null value removes the key/value pair.
The key to add to the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref>.
The value for the specified key.
keyword is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
The <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> is read-only.
-or- The <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> has a fixed size.
Provides an efficient and safe way to append a key and value to an existing <xref:System.Text.StringBuilder> object.

This method allows developers using a <xref:System.Text.StringBuilder> to create a collection of key/value pairs to be able to take advantage of the features included in the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> class when you add key/value pairs, without having to incur the overhead of creating and maintaining a <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance.
The `AppendKeyValuePair` method formats the key and value correctly and adds the new string to the supplied <xref:System.Text.StringBuilder>.
The <xref:System.Text.StringBuilder> to which to add the key/value pair.
The key to be added.
The value for the supplied key.
Provides an efficient and safe way to append a key and value to an existing <xref:System.Text.StringBuilder> object.

This method allows developers using a <xref:System.Text.StringBuilder> to create a collection of key/value pairs to be able to take advantage of the features included in the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> class when adding key/value pairs, without having to incur the overhead of creating and maintaining a <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance.
The `AppendKeyValuePair` method formats the key and value correctly and adds the new string to the supplied <xref:System.Text.StringBuilder>.
Although most data sources let you delimit fields by using quotation marks, ODBC does not--for ODBC connection strings, you must use curly braces ({}).
In order to have the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> use ODBC rules for delimiting fields, set the `useOdbcRules` parameter to `true`.
The <xref:System.Text.StringBuilder> to which to add the key/value pair.
The key to be added.
The value for the supplied key.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to use {} to delimit fields, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to use quotation marks.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder.ConnectionString*> property is visible in Visual Studio designers.

Developers creating designers that take advantage of the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> class must be able to make the connection string visible or invisible within the designer's property grid.
The BrowsableConnectionString property lets developers indicate that the property should be invisible by setting the property to `false`.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the connection string is visible within designers; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> otherwise.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Clears the contents of the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> instance.
The Clear method removes all key/value pairs from the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> and resets all corresponding properties.

This includes setting the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder.Count%2A> property to 0 and the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder.ConnectionString%2A> property to an empty string.
The <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> is read-only.
Clears the collection of <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor"></xref> objects on the associated <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref>.
This method is used by designers to clear all associated property descriptors on the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder>.
Gets or sets the connection string associated with the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref>.
This property returns a semicolon-delimited list of key/value pairs stored within the collection maintained by the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder>.
Each pair contains the key and value, separated by an equal sign.
The following example illustrates a typical connection string.

``` "Persist Security Info=False;Integrated Security=SSPI;Initial Catalog=AdventureWorks;Data Source=(local)" ``` Data providers may expect specific keys and values for each connection string property.
, These values are documented individually.
The <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> class does not validate the key/value pairs associated with its connection string, although classes that inherit from it can.

The ConnectionString property of the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> class acts generally as a mechanism for creating and parsing semicolon-delimited lists of key/value pairs separated with equal signs.
It provides no validation or other support specific to connection strings.
If you add items to the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> collection, the ConnectionString property will reflect the changes.
If you assign a value to the ConnectionString property, the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> will try to parse the value, using the semicolon and equal-sign delimiters.
The current connection string, created from the key/value pairs that are contained within the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref>.
The default value is an empty string.
An invalid connection string argument has been supplied.
Determines whether the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> contains a specific key.
The key to locate in the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> contains an entry with the specified key; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
keyword is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
Gets the current number of keys that are contained within the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder.ConnectionString*> property.
The number of keys that are contained within the connection string maintained by the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> instance.
Compares the connection information in this <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> object with the connection information in the supplied object.
Comparisons on key names are case insensitive; value comparisons are case sensitive.
The EquivalentTo method returns `true` if the key/value pairs are equal, regardless of their order.
The connection behavior of the two connection strings are equivalent, because order is never significant within connection strings.
However, different order may affect connection pooling behavior of connections based on these connection strings.
The <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> to be compared with this <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> object.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the connection information in both of the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> objects causes an equivalent connection string; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Fills a supplied <xref href="System.Collections.Hashtable"></xref> with information about all the properties of this <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Collections.Hashtable"></xref> to be filled with information about this <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> has a fixed size.
A fixed-size collection does not allow adding or removing elements after the collection is created, but it does allow modifying existing elements.

A fixed-size collection is just a collection with a wrapper that prevents adding and removing elements; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, including adding or removing elements, the fixed-size collection reflects those changes.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> has a fixed size; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> is read-only.
A read-only collection does not allow adding, removing, or modifying elements after the collection is created.

A read-only collection is just a collection with a wrapper that prevents modifying the collection; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, the read-only collection reflects those changes.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> is read-only; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the value associated with the specified key.
When you set this property, if the specified key already exists in the dictionary, the value is replaced; otherwise, a new element is created.
The key of the item to get or set.
The value associated with the specified key.

If the specified key is not found, trying to get it returns a null reference (<xref uid="langword_csharp_Nothing" name="Nothing" href=""></xref> in Visual Basic), and trying to set it creates a new element using the specified key.
Passing a null (<xref uid="langword_csharp_Nothing" name="Nothing" href=""></xref> in Visual Basic) key throws an <xref:System.ArgumentNullException>.
Assigning a null value removes the key/value pair.
keyword is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
The property is set, and the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> is read-only.
-or- The property is set, keyword does not exist in the collection, and the has a fixed size.
Gets an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> that contains the keys in the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref>.

The order of the values in the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> is unspecified, but it is the same order as the associated values in the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> returned by the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder.Values%2A> property.

The returned <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> is not a static copy; instead, the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> refers back to the keys in the original <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder>.
Therefore, changes to the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> are reflected in the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection>.
An <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> that contains the keys in the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref>.
Removes the entry with the specified key from the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> instance.

Because the Remove method returns a value that indicates its success, it is not required to look for the key before trying to remove the key/value pair from the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance.
The key of the key/value pair to be removed from the connection string in this <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the key existed within the connection string and was removed; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if the key did not exist.
keyword is null ( in Visual Basic)
The <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> is read-only, or the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> has a fixed size.
Indicates whether the specified key exists in this <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> instance.
This method behaves identically to the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder.ContainsKey%2A> method.
The key to locate in the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref> contains an entry with the specified key; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Copies the elements of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> to an <xref:System.Array>, starting at a particular <xref:System.Array> index.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo%2A>.
The one-dimensional <xref:System.Array> that is the destination of the elements copied from <xref:System.Collections.ICollection>.
The <xref:System.Array> must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in `array` at which copying begins.
Gets a value indicating whether access to the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> is synchronized (thread safe).
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
For more information, see <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if access to the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
For more information, see <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot%2A>.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection>.
Adds an element with the provided key and value to the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> object.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> interface.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary.Add%2A>.
The <xref:System.Object> to use as the key of the element to add.
The <xref:System.Object> to use as the value of the element to add.
Determines whether the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> object contains an element with the specified key.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> interface.
For more information, see <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary.Contains%2A>.
The key to locate in the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> object.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> contains an element with the key; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns an <xref:System.Collections.IDictionaryEnumerator> object for the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> object.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> interface.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary.GetEnumerator%2A>.
An <xref:System.Collections.IDictionaryEnumerator> object for the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> object.
Gets or sets the element with the specified key.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> interface.
For more information, see <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary.Item%2A>.
The key of the element to get or set.
The element with the specified key.
Removes the element with the specified key from the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> object.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> interface.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary.Remove%2A>.
The key of the element to remove.
Returns an enumerator that iterates through a collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator%2A>.
An <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> object that can be used to iterate through the collection.
Returns a collection of custom attributes for this instance of a component.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetAttributes%2A>.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection"></xref> containing the attributes for this object.
Returns the class name of this instance of a component.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetClassName%2A>.
The class name of the object, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the class does not have a name.
Returns the name of this instance of a component.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetComponentName%2A>.
The name of the object, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the object does not have a name.
Returns a type converter for this instance of a component.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A>.

A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter"></xref> that is the converter for this object, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if there is no <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter"></xref> for this object.
Returns the default event for this instance of a component.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetDefaultEvent%2A>.

An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor"></xref> that represents the default event for this object, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if this object does not have events.
Returns the default property for this instance of a component.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetDefaultProperty%2A>.

A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor"></xref> that represents the default property for this object, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if this object does not have properties.
Returns an editor of the specified type for this instance of a component.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetEditor%2A>.
A <xref:System.Type> that represents the editor for this object.
An <xref:System.Object> of the specified type that is the editor for this object, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the editor cannot be found.
Returns the events for this instance of a component.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetEvents%2A>.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptorCollection"></xref> that represents the events for this component instance.
Returns the events for this instance of a component using the specified attribute array as a filter.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetEvents%2A>.
An array of type <xref:System.Attribute> that is used as a filter.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptorCollection"></xref> that represents the filtered events for this component instance.
Returns the properties for this instance of a component.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetProperties%2A>.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection"></xref> that represents the properties for this component instance.
Returns the properties for this instance of a component using the attribute array as a filter.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetProperties%2A>.
An array of type <xref:System.Attribute> that is used as a filter.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection"></xref> that represents the filtered properties for this component instance.
Returns an object that contains the property described by the specified property descriptor.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetPropertyOwner%2A>.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor"></xref> that represents the property whose owner is to be found.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the owner of the specified property.
Returns the connection string associated with this <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref>.
The current <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder.ConnectionString*> property.
Retrieves a value corresponding to the supplied key from this <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref>.

The TryGetValue method lets developers safely retrieve a value from a <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> without needing to first call the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder.ContainsKey%2A> method.
Because TryGetValue does not raise an exception when you call it, passing in a nonexistent key, you do not have to look for a key before retrieving its value.
Calling TryGetValue with a nonexistent key will place the null value (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) in the `value` parameter.
The key of the item to retrieve.
The value corresponding to the `key`.
if keyword was found within the connection string, otherwise.
keyword contains a null value ( in Visual Basic).
Gets an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> that contains the values in the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref>.

The order of the values in the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> is unspecified, but it is the same order as the associated keys in the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> returned by the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder.Keys%2A> method.

The returned <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> is not a static copy; instead, the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> refers back to the values in the original <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder>.
Therefore, changes to the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> are reflected in the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection>.
An <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> that contains the values in the <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder"></xref>.
